title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: A stage, rehearsal, day. Stan, Kyle, and Wendy are in costume on stage. Stan is dressed in a white suit and bowtie, and a fake beard and moustache. Kyle is dressed as a country doctor with starched collar, and Wendy is dressed in white pants, purple coat and beret, and bowtie. The stage itself has a door prop and a tripod table with a bowl and jar atop it. Kyle enters through the door.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Doctor, doctor! Will our daughter be okay?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: I am sorry, Mr. and Mrs. Keller, but I'm afraid your daughter Helen still cannot see, hear, or speak.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Oh no! NO!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: 'Ere 'ere, my good wife, 'ere is nothing we can do.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: My poor little Helen.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Timmiihhh!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: She can't see or hear us, John.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Heh-aaaah, Timmih!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: E-yes. Perhaps she should go to an asyluh.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Stan, what the hell is wrong with you? I can't understand your lines!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: 'Cause the 'eard 'urts my 'ace.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Can we take a lunch break now?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: No! If we want our play to be better than the kindergartners' play, we have to rehearse as much as possible! Now let's continue the scene!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Hello. My name is Anne Sullivan, and I believe I can teach this child to communicate.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Uh-eally? Uh you think so?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Water, Helen! Waaa-terr!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Agh oh-ight, Timmih!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: God-damnit, Timmy! Helen Keller isn't suposed to talk!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Hey you guys! We got a big problem!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: What is it, Butters?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: The kidnergartners! I just came from their dress rehearsal. Hoh, it's good, you guys. It's real good!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: How good?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: They got Pilgrim outfits! And Indian ones, too! They've got singing and dancing and boy you've never seen such a show! Why, it's a Thanksgiving extravaganza!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: We can't be outdone by the kindergartners!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Oh, now what?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Oh yeah, we can't!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Alright, alright! Quiet down! Look, we still got four days until the Thanksgiving festival; that's plenty of time to revamp our play!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Revamp how? The rules are that the fourth grade class has to perform the Helen Keller Story.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Yeah, but nobody told us how we had to do it. We can have Thanksgiving stuff and music numbers, too.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Well, we can add music numbers, but how do we make the Helen Keller story more Thanksgivingy?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: I know! How about, instead of a dog, Helen Keller has a pet turkey.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Yeah, a turkey that could do tricks.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Yeah

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: That's the spirit, gang! Alright. Stan and Wendy, you go out and find some musical instruments! Kenny and Clyde, take some kids and buy some Thanksgiving decorations for the set! Kyle and Timmy, you go out and find a turkey!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Okay!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: This is gonna be the best version of the Miracle Worker ever!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Yay!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: a barn, with no snow around it. Cows are grazing on the grass outside. Inside, a rancher shows Timmy and Kyle around the barn.

text: What kind of turkey are you lookin' for?

text: A smart one, that can do tricks.

text: Well, I ain't got a whole lot left, it bein' almost Thanksgiving and all. Go ahead, just pick one out.

text: Timmaay!

text: Uh, Timmy, if we back to the other kids with that turkey they're gonna be pissed!

text: TIMMAY!

text: Yeah. Best you not take that one. I was just about to take it out in the yard and putt a bullet in its head.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: ...God-damnit, here!  Alright, Timmy, let's go!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Guys, I want you all to meet Jeffrey Maynard. He's South Park's biggest expert on musical theater, AND, he played the lead in Les Misérables at the Denver Community Playhouse for five weeks.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Bravo.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Do you think we could make up a good Thanksgiving play in four days?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: I would swear it on my life. Your play shall want for nothing.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Hooray!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Now, the first thing a good musical needs is a big opening number. Something that sets up the entire show.

text: Alright! Places, everybody! Bring in the turkey!  What the hell is that?

text: It's a turkey.  His name is Gobbles.

text: GOBBLES!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Um, we... sssort of spend all the money on this... one...

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: GOBBLES!

text: Kyle, can I talk to you over here for a second?  Kyle? Why do you do these things to me?

text: I didn't do anything to you. Timmy saw the turkey and wanted to get it. What do you want me to say to him?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: You say, "No, Timmy, you can't have that turkey! Bad Timmy!"

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Look, I know it isn't exactly what we wanted, but maybe we can train it.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: He's not gonna work, Kyle. The whole point was to make our play better than the kindergartners.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Yeah, that turkey sucks.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Wait! What's that, you say? A thanksgiving turkey is what you require? I know of a turkey.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: You do?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: During my years on Broadway I... worked with a turkey who could do all kinds of tricks. She even jumped through a hoop of fire.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Cool! Can you get it for us?

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: I will go promptly and call her trainer. On the morrow you shall have your trick performing turkey.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: Alright!

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: South Park, Timmy's house. Timmy is in bed asleep. Soon, Gobbles hops up on the bed and drops his head on the covers. He slowly inches up to Timmy's face, looking at Timmy all the while, and settles in next to him. Gobbles soon falls asleep. Timmy's left hand comes to rest on Gobbles' body. An exterior shot with the moon low in the sky is shown and fades out.

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL

title: HELEN KELLER  THE MUSICAL
text: the turkeys leave the room and enter another one. A movie screen faces them. Another worker appears and closes the door behind the turkeys. The turkeys remain excited until a movie comes up with sweeping views of nature. The turkeys calm down, and a view of clouds zipping along the sky follows. Then waterfalls. The lights come up and a giant saw comes out and chops the heads off all the turkeys save one. The saw rises. Only Gobbles survives, and he keeps his head low as he finds a clearing. A large board appears and pushes the decapitated turkeys out an opening on the opposite wall. The bodies are then lifted up and returned to the truck they came in, but the building they come out of is 3C. Gobbles falls off the truck and ends up on the floor. Jimbo and other South Park hunters pass by and notice
